name: Gintama
plot: In an era where aliens have invaded and taken over feudal Tokyo, an unemployed samurai finds work however he can.

episodes.plot: This episode shows various scenes from the war between samurais and the Amanto, focusing on Gintoki's fights alongside Kotaro Katsura, Shinsuke Takasugi and others. In the end, the episode is revealed to be a trailer from a film, which was in fact fake.
episodes.title: Jump Anime Tour 2008- Birth of White Demon

episodes.plot:
A re-telling of the Benizakura arc.

The silver-haired samurai Sakata Gintoki investigates the disappearance of a legendary sword named Benizakura while his partners Kagura and Shimura Shinpachi try to find out what has happened to Gintoki's friend, Kotaro Katsura.
episodes.title: Benizakura Arc Special

episodes.plot: Odd jobs wake up to find a (not so) familiar spirit, who tries to explain the importance of having special moves.
episodes.title: Jump Festa 2014 Special

episodes.plot: This special celebrates 10 years of the Gintama anime and provides a preview of the upcoming Shogun Assassination Arc.
episodes.title: Jump Festa 2015 Special

episodes.plot: Tsukuyo and co are caught up in a conspiracy involving an underground drug that causes people to fall in love with the first person they see.
episodes.title: A Heart Without Love Does Not Smoke
An Everlasting Flower

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi, and Kagura receive a request from a man who wants them to make him stronger.
episodes.title: You Guys!! Do You Even Have a Gintama! (1)

episodes.plot: Gintoki's group goes to take back a house for a man who's been conned.
episodes.title: You Guys!! Do You Even Have a Gintama! (2)

episodes.plot: Sakata Gintoki meets Shimura Shinpachi.  The two proceeds to save Shinpachi's older sister from an amanto entertainment club.
episodes.title: Nobody with Naturally Wavy Hair Can be That Bad!

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Shinpachi meet an amanto alien girl who's been chased after by gangster.
episodes.title: Watch Out! Weekly Shonen JUMP Sometimes Comes Out on Saturdays!

episodes.plot: Gintoki's group's been asked to deliver a package to an amanto alien embassy.
episodes.title: Make Friends You Can Call by Their Nicknames, Even When You're an Old Fart!

episodes.plot: A man tries to break out of jail, to attend a pop star's concert.
episodes.title: Keep Your Promise Even If It Kills You

episodes.plot: The group is hired to find an amanto alien prince's pet.
episodes.title: Responsible Owners Should Clean Up After Their Pets!

episodes.plot: Shinpachi's sister is being stalked by a Shinsengumi officer.
episodes.title: There Is Butt a Fine Line Between Persistence and Stubbornness

episodes.plot: The Shinsengumi goes to avenge their commander's defeat.
episodes.title: Fighting Should Be Done With Fists!

episodes.plot: The group picks up a giant white dog.
episodes.title: Eat Something Sour When You're Tired!

episodes.plot: The trio helps an old man to track down a woman whom he met when he was young. Shown as a one hour special with episode 12.
episodes.title: Look, Overly Sticky Sweet Dumplings Are Not Real Dumplings, You Idiot!

episodes.plot: The kabuki district has been robbed by a mysterious thief.
episodes.title: People Who Make Good First Impressions Usually Suck!

episodes.plot: The group is hired to find a missing girl.  However, the group is dragged into deeper trouble than they originally anticipated.  Gintoki may require the help of his old friend Katsura to help him out of this mess.
episodes.title: If You're Going to Cosplay, Go All Out!

episodes.plot: The Shinsengumi is asked to protect an amanto alien official and Kagura meets a princess who's sneaked out from the castle.
episodes.title: Boys Have a Weird Ritual that Makes Them Think They Turn Into Men When They Touch Frogs! - You Only Gotta Wash Under Your Armpits - Just the Armpits

episodes.plot: The group enters Sadaharu in a pet competition, with Katsura and his pet being their opponent.
episodes.title: Pets Resemble Their Owners!

episodes.plot: A man who's been fired for assaulting an amanto royal goes job hunting, only to met with failure repeatedly.
episodes.title: If You Stop and Think About It, Your Life's a Lot Longer as an Old Guy Than a Kid! Whoa, Scary!!

episodes.plot: A rebel plans to asssinate the shogun during a festival.
episodes.title: Sons Only Take After Their Fathers' Negative Attributes

episodes.plot: The group and Shinsengumi attempt to capture a man who's been stealing women's underwear.
episodes.title: Oh Yeah! Our Crib is Number One!

episodes.plot: In an effort to get some quick cash, Gintoki and Hasegawa, along with Shinpachi, Kagura, and Otae, head to the beach to get rid of a monster that's been terrorizing the area.
episodes.title: Why is the Sea So Salty Because You City Folk Pee Whenever You Go Swimming!

episodes.plot: The Shinsengumi has been haunted by a mysterious being.
episodes.title: Watch Out For Conveyor Belts!

episodes.plot: The group helps an amanto to protect his pond from developers and Gintoki goes all over town trying to find an electric fan replacement during a heatwave.
episodes.title: If You're a Man, Try the Swordfish - If You Go to Sleep With the Fan On, You'll Get a Stomachache, So Be Careful

episodes.plot: A female ninja stays over at the Yorozuya.
episodes.title: Marriage is Prolonging an Illusion for Your Whole Life

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi and Kagura go on a space trip in which Kagura had won tickets for.
episodes.title: When You're In a Fix, Keep On Laughing, Laughing...

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Katsura get dragged into being cross-dressers.
episodes.title: Cute Faces Are Always Hiding Something

episodes.plot: The series is entering into its third season! But the Yorozuya have other concerns: a battle of wits and deception to take reign of the sukiyaki pot!
episodes.title: A Shared Soup Pot is a Microcosm of Life

episodes.plot: The group goes to get Shinpachi's childhood friend out of a gang.
episodes.title: Don't Be Shy - Just Raise Your Hand and Say It

episodes.plot: After Okita showed them an underground death match arena (Rengokukan), the group proceeds to track down the reigning champion of those death matches.
episodes.title: Some Things Can't Be Cut with a Sword

episodes.plot: A police department head official brings Kondo to a meeting to discuss the incident happened at the Rengokukan.
episodes.title: Good Things Never Come in Twos (but Bad Things Do)

episodes.plot: An amanto goes around town to steal swords of value. Meanwhile Kagura steals Gintoki's wooden sword and tries to sell it and Space cockroaches terrorize the town.
episodes.title: Don't Panic - There's a Return Policy! - I Told You to Pay Attention to the News!

episodes.plot: Otsu receives a threat letter.  The trio goes to investigate.
episodes.title: Even Teen Idols Act Like You Guys

episodes.plot: Gintoki has amnesia after a car accident.  His friends try to get his memory back.
episodes.title: You Always Remember the Things that Matter the Least

episodes.plot: Gintoki who still does not have his memory back, works at a factory which produces a mysterious items.  Meanwhile, Shinpachi and Kagura goes to retrieve Gintoki.
episodes.title: Life Moves on Like a Conveyor Belt

episodes.plot: Sakamoto sends two amanto craftsmen to help rebuild the Yorozuya as repayment for him crashing his spaceship into the place.
episodes.title: Mistaking Someone's Name is Rude!

episodes.plot: Shinpachi saves a girl with cat ears while on a train ride.  Later in a letter she sends him, the girl proceeds to ask him out.
episodes.title: Love Doesn't Require a Manual (1)

episodes.plot: Shinpachi deals with the kitty-dressed thief and Kondou's uncle gets him, Hijikata and Okita to help get her daughter to dump her boyfriend in which he is not approved of.
episodes.title: Love Doesn't Require a Manual (2) - You Can't Judge a Person by His Appearance, Either

episodes.plot: A colleague of Otae has been scammed of her money by a cult.  The Yorozuya and Otae goes to uncover the secret of the cult.
episodes.title: People with Dark Pasts Can't Shut Up

episodes.plot: Gintoki meets Santa and has to help him deliver gifts and Gintoki and Hattori fight over a year end double-issue of Jump (magazine).
episodes.title: People Who Say that Santa Doesn't Really Exist Actually Want to Believe in Him - Prayer Won't Make Your Worldly Desires Go Away! Control Yourself

episodes.plot: Everyone's participating in the neighborhood snow building contest-- with disastrous results and an old man tries to get his wife to look at his fireworks & enjoy it.
episodes.title: Only Children Play in the Snow - Eating Ice Cream In Winter Is Awesome

episodes.plot: Katsura's injures his leg while escaping from the Shinsengumi and uses a ramen shop as a temporary hideout.
episodes.title: Ramen Shops with Long Menus Never Do Well

episodes.plot: A mysterious and famous hunter, Umibouzu, pays a visit when an alien appears in Edo.
episodes.title: Give a Thought to Planned Pregnancy

episodes.plot: Dissatisfies with Gintoki's reaction to Kagura's departure, Shinpachi quits and goes after Kagura.
episodes.title: You Can't Judge a Movie by Its Title

episodes.plot: Gintoki, along with Umibouzu, goes to combat the alien; while at the same time avoiding the Shogunate's side of attack (on the alien).
episodes.title: You Know What Happens if You Pee on a Worm

episodes.plot: Otae, Sa-chan, and Catherine all try to go for the series' heroine position and Katsura enlists the Yorozuya to help him save Elizabeth-- but they need some ninja finesse to do it first.
episodes.title: Make Characters So Anybody Can Tell Who They Are by Just Their Silhouettes

episodes.plot: Katsura, along with the Yorozuya, goes to find Sarutobi Ayame to train them on ninja skills; in preparation for their Elizabeth rescue.
episodes.title: Mom's Busy, Too, So Quit Complaining About What's for Dinner

episodes.plot: Sadaharu becomes a demon that the Yorozuya tries to rescue with the help of former priestess sisters.
episodes.title: Walk Your Dog at an Appropriate Speed

episodes.plot: Otae and Ane square off to keep their jobs by trying to out-earn each other.
episodes.title: Adults Only. We Wouldn't Want Anyone Immature in Here

episodes.plot: The Yorozuya get a new neighbor, a frightening looking Amanto named Hedoro, and assume he's up to something.
episodes.title: Do Cherries Come from Cherry Trees

episodes.plot: A group of assassins want to take Hijikata out. The problem: none of them really didn't expect what would happen when he encountered Gintoki who, with Shinpachi and Kagura encounters an old man and was "forced" to play games with him; meanwhile, Sa-chan's master passed away and she went to attend his funeral.
episodes.title: The More You're Alike, the More You Fight - Whatever You Play, Play to Win

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Hasegawa run into some gambling problems.
episodes.title: A Life Without Gambling is Like Sushi Without Wasabi

episodes.plot: Gintoki gives his suggestions to the editor and author of "Gintaman" on what should the series improve on.
episodes.title: Pending Means Pending, It's Not Final

episodes.plot: A baby's dropped off in front of the Yorozuya; claming it's Gintoki's son.
episodes.title: Milk Should Be Served at Body Temperature

episodes.plot: Itou Kamotarou (appeared on the previous episode) proceeds with his agenda. Hijikata seeks help from the Yorozuya to save the Shinsengumi from destruction.
episodes.title: If You Want to See Someone, Make an Appo First

episodes.plot: While trying to burn old JUMP issues, Gintoki is captured by a female fire fighter in search of a local arsonist.
episodes.title: Stress Makes You Bald, but It's Stressful to Avoid Stress, So You End Up Stressed Out Anyway, So in the End There's Nothing You Can Do

episodes.plot: A mother looking for her son in Edo enlists the help of Yorozuya.
episodes.title: Mothers Everywhere Are All the Same

episodes.plot: Continuing from the last episode, it is discovered that the son turned out to be the No.1 "Pimp" in Kabuki District.
episodes.title: Don't Make Munching Noises When You Eat

episodes.plot: Terakado Tsu (Otsu) goes to be one day chief of the Shinsengumi to improve its image.
episodes.title: Keep an Eye on the Chief for the Day

episodes.plot: Mutsu requests the Yorozuya recover some stolen cargo.
episodes.title: When Looking For Things You've Lost, Remember What You Were Doing On The Day You Lost It

episodes.plot: A serial killer has been going around town-- and one of the crew meets him head on! In the meantime, Gintoki is requested to locate "Benizakura", an unlucky sword stolen from its owner.
episodes.title: Croquette Sandwiches Are Always the Most Popular Food Sold at the Stalls

episodes.plot: Kagura gets captured. Tetsuko goes to visit the injured Gintoki and tells him the truth about the benisakura sword.
episodes.title: Be Careful Not to Leave Your Umbrella Somewhere

episodes.plot: Shinpachi and Elizabeth go on the ship to attack Okada.  A battle rages on the ship, at which Kagura manages to escape from captivity.  On the other hand, Gintoki and Tetsuko (benisakura forger Tetsuya's sister) head towards Takasugi.
episodes.title: The Sun Will Rise Again

episodes.plot: The battle comes to a conclusion, with benisakura finally taken over Okada's body, and Gintoki will have to use the sword Tetsuko gave him to stop this.
episodes.title: On a Moonless Night, Insects Are Drawn to the Light

episodes.plot: Yamasaki is sent by Hijikata to investigate what has happened with that fight between Katsura and Takasugi groups.  He goes around asking different people, though fails to get any real answers.
episodes.title: Even Mummy Hunters Sometimes Turn into Mummys

episodes.plot: Hattori Zenzo has been hired to kidnap a girl who is able to foresee the future.  Meanwhile, the Yorozuya has been hired to protect the very same girl.
episodes.title: The Preview Section in JUMP is Always Unreliable

episodes.plot: A set of TV crews follow Katsura around for a day to do a television program special interview.
episodes.title: Eating Nmaibo Can Make You Full in No Time!

episodes.plot: Kagura's beetle was killed during a beetle fighting match.  She tries to drag Gintoki and Shinpachi to go beetle hunting with her.  That only succeeds when they know there is a high demand for the beetles - meaning they can make money of it.  The trio encounters the Shinsengumi who also happens to be capturing beetles for reason unknown.
episodes.title: Rhinoceros Beetles Teach Boys that Life is Precious

episodes.plot: An old dango shop owner accepts a challenge from the owner of a popular new dessert shop.
episodes.title: Dango Over Flowers

episodes.plot: Gintoki gets into an accident with a delivery girl who has the "Need for Speed". / As Gintoki recovers from the delivery incident, Sa-chan is forced to weigh both her feminine needs and her assassin duties when working a mission at the same hospital.
episodes.title: For the Wind Is the Life - The Ideal Girlfriend Is Always Minami

episodes.plot: Every year during the Matsuri festival, a "Courage Test" event is held. This year Gintoki, Shinpachi and Kagura helps out in the event.
episodes.title: Like a Haunted House, Life is Filled with Horrors

episodes.plot: Kamenashi (the turtle) tells the group about Otohime, the owner of the Dragon Palace, that they are the only ones who are capable of stopping her plan.
episodes.title: Please Help by Separating Your Trash

episodes.plot: The group goes to save Tae. On their way, Shinpachi, Gintoki and Katsura stumble upon a room where they learn about Otohime's past.
episodes.title: Too Many Cuties Can Make You Sick

episodes.plot: Otohime's past lover's will gives the antidote (to the aging virus) to Shinpachi. However, their time is limited as a missile carrying another batch of the aging virus, aimed at Edo, is about to be sent off.
episodes.title: Some Data Cannot Be Erased

episodes.plot: Sadaharu is in "heat" and Yorozuya tries to find him a mate. / Katsura attempts to take a driving lesson-- a "Might Happen" driving lesson, that is.
episodes.title: A Dog's Paws Smell Fragrant - Drive With a 'Might' Attitude

episodes.plot: Katsura goes undercover at an Amanto-only Japanese restaurant to stop a radical branch of the Joi Faction's plan of causing havoc. Meanwhile, Hasegawa takes over a sushi bar while the owner's at hospital. The Yorozuya ends up helping after the sushi machine went out of order.
episodes.title: Think for a Minute Now, Do Matsutake Mushrooms Really Taste All that Good

episodes.plot: Edo's under attack by M-unibrow zombies!
episodes.title: The Manga Writer Becomes a Pro, After Doing a Stock of Manuscripts

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi and Kagura recaps what has happened to date on their 2nd Year Anniversary special.
episodes.title: Don't Complain About Your Job at Home, Do It Somewhere Else

episodes.plot: Otae's childhood friend, Kyubei Yagyu appears and takes Otae back to fufil her childhood promise.
episodes.title: In Those Situations, Keep Quiet and Cook Red Rice With Beans

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi, Kagura, Kondo, Hijikata and Sogo goes to the Yagyu family premises and attempts to get Otae back.
episodes.title: Yesterday's Enemy, After All Is Said and Done, Is Still the Enemy

episodes.plot: The battle at the Yagyu family premises continues.
episodes.title: People Who Are Picky About Food Are Also Picky About People, Too

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Isao, Toujou, and Binbokusai are in the toilet, all looking for something to wipe....
episodes.title: Four Heads are Better than One

episodes.plot: The battle between Gintoki and Binbokusai begins; meanwhile, Shinpachi discovered that Kyubei was girl.
episodes.title: When Someone Who Wears Glasses Takes Them Off, It Looks Like Something's Missing

episodes.plot: The final episode in the Yagyu story arc.
episodes.title: A Woman's Best Make-up Is Her Smile

episodes.plot: The Yorozuya attempt to rid a town of monsters for some quick cash / The piggish Amanto female saved by the Yorozuya from the drug pirates enlists them to save her boyfriend from his former gang.
episodes.title: You Say Kawaii so Often, You Must Really Think You're Cute Stuff

episodes.plot: The cold/flu season hits hard; Yorozuya is enlisted to help out at Otae's workplace.
episodes.title: Rank has nothing to do with luck

episodes.plot: A washed out detective tells his tale about his life-long quest of pursuing of a thief who turned from righteous to evil.
episodes.title: Hard-boiled Egg on a Man's Heart

episodes.plot: The detective, Gintoki, Shinpachi and Kagura crashed into a mansion in an attempt to capture the thief.
episodes.title: Hard-Boiled Eggs Don't Crack

episodes.plot: Sougo's older sister, Mitsuba, arrived in Edo for a visit. Hijikata and Mitsuba's relationship is revealed.
episodes.title: It's Often Difficult to Sleep When You're Engrossed With Counting Sheep

episodes.plot: Mitsuba is in bad condition due to her sickness; Sougo decides to go help Hijikata.
episodes.title: Perform a German Suplex on a Woman Who Asks If She or the Job Is More Important

episodes.plot: Tojo Ayumu enlisted the help of Yorozuya to help make a "woman" out of the tomboyish Kyubei. Gintoki's solution: a Gokon.
episodes.title: The Most Exciting Part of a Group Date is Before it Starts

episodes.plot: The spirit of the sword that Gintoki carries appears to teach Gintoki, Shinpachi and Kagura an ultimate technique.
episodes.title: What Happens Twice, Happens Thrice

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi Kagura and Hasegawa are hospitalised (The Yorozuya gang for food poisoning from eating unfresh crabs; Hasegawa got knocked down by a car). They get themeslves involved when a young nurse falls in love with one of her patients.
episodes.title: The More Delicious the Food, the Nastier It Is When It Goes Bad

episodes.plot: Our female characters joined a "slimming" camp to shed off their extra weights.
episodes.title: If You Want To Lose Weight, Then Stop Eating and Start Moving

episodes.plot: An assassin has been hired to kill Matsudaira; but encounters unexpected scenerios while carrying out the task.
episodes.title: Be a Person Who Can See People's Strong Points and Not Their Weak Points

episodes.plot: It's Valentine's Day, and a space heroine comes to Edo to confess her intention to...
episodes.title: Even a hero has issues

episodes.plot: Hasegawa gets a job. While commuting on his first day, an accident lands him in jail with harassment charges.
episodes.title: When Riding A Train, Make Sure You Grab the Straps With Both Hands

episodes.plot: The trial of Hasegawa's harassment charge comes to a conclusion.
episodes.title: Men, Be a Madao

episodes.plot: A planet's attacked by mysterious beings. It is up to Umi Bouzu to settle things and to out an end to the attacks. How will the end turn out?
episodes.title: If You're a Man, Don't Give Up

episodes.plot: Old gangmates of Catherine try to convince her to join them on a heist.
episodes.title: Exaggerate the Tales of Your Exploits by a Third, So Everyone Has a Good Time - Men Have a Weakness for Girls Who Sell Flowers and Work in Pastry Shops

episodes.plot: The popular game console "Owee" is finally on sale. The otaku, as well as the Yorozuya and the Shinsengumi are at the store trying to get their hands on the consoles.
episodes.title: Play Video Games for Only an Hour a Day

episodes.plot: Yorozuya and Shinsengumi are divided into two teams to play against each other in a video-gaming contest (for their chance to win free "Owee").
episodes.title: Life and Video Games are Full of Bugs

episodes.plot: Gintoki gives his suggestions to the editor and author of "Gintaman" on what should the series improve on.
episodes.title: The More Something Is Disliked, the More Lovely It Is

episodes.plot: Some Shinsengumi member shows up, and it is soon revealed to be a rival of Hijikata.
episodes.title: Rules Are Made to be Broken

episodes.plot: Itou Kamotarou (appeared on the previous episode) proceeds with his agenda. Hijikata seeks help from the Yorozuya to save the Shinsengumi from destruction.
episodes.title: Otaku Are Talkative

episodes.plot: Okita appears to save Kondou from the rebel Shinsengumi led by Itou. The Yorozuya along with Hijikata are also on their way to the scene.
episodes.title: There's a Thin Line Between Strengths and Weaknesses

episodes.plot: Now fully free from the curse, Hijikata battles against Itou. Meanwhile, Gintoki is forced into a confrontation with none other than Bansai, right hand man to Takasugi.
episodes.title: Important Things Are Hard To See

episodes.plot: The concluding finale to the (Itou) Shinsengumi Discord Arc.
episodes.title: It's All About the Beat and Timing

episodes.plot: Kagura accidentally knocks out an international soccer team when their capitan was out by giving them water from a janitors bucket and now The Yorozuya and others have to fill the teams spots.
episodes.title: Love Is Often Played Out In Sudden Death

episodes.plot: The Yorozuya are requested to help a Yakuza boss's son who has become a hikikomori, but little do they know how dangerous this job could turn out to be...
episodes.title: Kids Don't Understand How Their Parents Feel

episodes.plot: The Yorozuya's Yakuza client has died, and the group's young new leader carries a dark secret about the boss's son.
episodes.title: Some Things Are Better Left Unsaid

episodes.plot: Yamazaki, with the intent of spying on the Joui faction, undergoes the necessary testing and training as one of its new recruits.
episodes.title: Life is a test

episodes.plot: Katsura is inprisoned, and fellow inmate Suekichi tries to find a way to make Katsura fall asleep so that he can make a his escape.
episodes.title: People Are All Escapees of Their Own Inner Prisons

episodes.plot:
Yorozuya's asked by a crossdresser hostess to help with the courting of a host. 

A story about Kagura and an umbrella during the rainy season.
episodes.title: Definitely Do Not Let Your Girlfriend See the Things You Use for Cross-Dressing - There's Almost a 100% Chance You'll Forget Your Umbrella and Hate Yourself For It

episodes.plot: Katsura briefly takes over the series in an attempt to promote his birthday; in the main story, Gintoki attempts to help Tama find a way to enjoy herself.
episodes.title: A Birthday in Your Twenties Has No Deep Meaning - Lucky Is a Man Who Gets Up and Goes to Work

episodes.plot: A member of the Shinsengumi suggests a "washroom revolution". Eventually it evolves into a battle of Shinsengumi vs. washroom germs.
episodes.title: Cleaning the Toilet Cleanses the Soul

episodes.plot: Hijikata tells Matsudaira that he would fend off the store clerks who are coming-on to Matsudaira's daughter, Kuriko, just so he'd spare their lives. Kuriko mistakens Hijikata as some other person and starts to have feelings for him.
episodes.title: They Say Soy Sauce On Pudding Tastes Like Sea Urchin, But Soy Sauce On Pudding Only Tastes Like Pudding and Soy Sauce

episodes.plot: While Gintoki, Shinpachi, Kagura, Hasegawa, Tae, Kyuubei and Katsura are on their way to the legendary Dragon Palace, a quarrel between them ends up bringing them onto an isolated island.
episodes.title: Summer Vacation is the Most Fun Right Before It Begins

episodes.plot: The time to settle the battle for the official fan club title is finally here. The match between Shinpachi and Hijikata is a card battle using Otsu chip playing cards. Never knowing such a thing existed, Shinpachi rushes to the vendor for some cards. Hijikata on the other hand is fully prepared and delivers the ultra powerful card “Melancholy 5-minutes before start”! Hijikata’s range of powerful attacks forces Shinpachi to stay on the defensive. Can he possibly find a way to make a counterattack?
episodes.title: The older, the wiser

episodes.plot: The group goes to save Tae. On their way, Shinpachi, Gintoki and Katsura stumble upon a room where they learn about Otohime's past.
episodes.title: Beauty is like a summer fruit

episodes.plot: Otohime's past lover's will gives the antidote (to the aging virus) to Shinpachi. However, their time is limited as a missile carrying another batch of the aging virus, aimed at Edo, is about to be sent off.
episodes.title: Even if Your Back is Bent, Go Straight Forward

episodes.plot: Smoking ban comes to Edo. Heavy smoker Hijikata is desperate to find cigarettes.
episodes.title: Within Each Box of Cigarettes, Are One or Two Cigarettes That Smell Like Horse Dung

episodes.plot: Part A: "The quality of overseas Japanese restaurants are around that of school cafeterias." Katsura goes undercover at an Amanto-only Japanese restaurant to stop a radical branch of the Joi Faction's plan of causing havoc.  Part B: "Plates won't be returned once they're taken."Hasegawa takes over a sushi bar while the owner's at hospital. The Yorozuya ends up helping after the sushi machine went out of order.
episodes.title: Japanese Restaurants Abroad Taste Pretty Much Like School Cafeteria Lunches - Once You've Taken a Dish, You Can't Put It Back

episodes.plot: The Yorozuya goes into the world of online role playing game (RPG) to search for the Amantos who are responsible for turning part of their bodies into screwdriver heads.
episodes.title: Novices Only Need a Flathead and a Phillips

episodes.plot: Gintoki, Shinpachi, and Kagura go around in the online role playing game to find powerful players to be their companions on their search for the Amanto. Their new found companions however, are not what they seem to be.
episodes.title: Imagination Is Nurtured In the 8th Grade

episodes.plot: Gintoki and the gang arrive at Tama’s main system. The group tries to devise a battle strategy for fighting the Great Archfiend Tapir’s black body suit minions. But they can’t come to an agreement. Deciding it’s a waste of time, Kagura charges alone into the swarm of black body suits. Using this as a diversion, the group storms the enemy base, only to be surrounded after Gintoki and the Leukocyte King get into an argument. But during their rumble to decide who’s the strongest, the two wind up destroying the black body suit minions. And finally, the Great Archfiend Tapir appears!
episodes.title: Always Keep a Screwdriver In Your Heart

episodes.plot: Otsu has overcome her past scandals and become Edo's top idol. And the release date of her new single has finally been announced! Shinpachi and her other fans are overjoyed at the news. But there trouble arises right before the release. Otsu's music producer, Tsunpo, is late with the creation of her song and says the release will be postponed.
episodes.title: When Nagging Goes Too Far It Becomes Intimidating

episodes.plot:
Part A On top of the Odd Jobs building, two awfully familiar men seem to be scheming. They manage to hide themselves from several visitors, but they are spotted by the man who’ll cause the biggest mess of all: Katsura! 

Part B Gintoki’s alarm goes off, and he decides to takes a shower to sober up. While in the shower, something happens to Gintoki! Seems Kagura and Shinpachi are also caught up in the mess, and they wonder how this could have happened to them... The three heroes face a crisis like none other!
episodes.title: Entering the Final Chapter!

episodes.plot: The fan club members for Edo's top idol, Tsu Terakado, are at the beach practicing their choreography for an upcoming concert. But Takachin notices his fellow members’ enthusiasm getting sloppy. One of the fan club officers has started exchanging e-mails with a girl he met through a blog. Shinpachi is furious the officer has broken their club rule of “Secret communication with women is forbidden.” As their captain, he puts some spirit into them, but…
episodes.title: Some Things Can Only Be Conveyed Through the Written Word

episodes.plot: Even though it’s believed the letters are coming from Okita, Shinpachi's response letter turn out to be a big hit. Urara is happy her older sister has received a response to her letters. But her older sister confesses that she sent Urara's picture with the letter. And it looks like both Shinpachi and Urara sent someone else's pictures with their letters!
episodes.title: Sometimes You Must Meet to Understand

episodes.plot: Urara's older sister learns that Shinpachi sent Okita's picture with his letters. Shinpachi desperately tries to apologize, but Urara's older sister tells him that she wants to help him get Urara to like him. Afterwards, Gintoki and the others meet up with Urara and Okita. They try to get Urara's attention, but she is only interested in Okita. Urara's older sister can’t do anything about it and runs away in regret. Shinpachi is worried and goes after her, but…
episodes.title: Sometimes You Can't Tell Just By Meeting Someone

episodes.plot: Worried about her pet’s sudden drop in appetite, Kagura takes Sadaharu to the veterinary hospital. Katsura happens to be there as well, explaining how Elizabeth is in bad health and has been hospitalized to undergo surgery. Fortunately Sadaharu’s condition is nothing serious, but he’s kept overnight just to be safe. Around the same time, an old dog that has also been hospitalized is about to take its last breath. It seems the owner is in critical condition as well, and with only death awaiting them both, Kagura decides to take the old dog to its owner.
episodes.title: Beware of Food You Pick Up Off the Ground

episodes.plot: To let the dying dog Kintaro see its owner for one last time, Kagura and Katsura sneak it out of the hospital…only to find themselves caught in the war between the “Planet Eaters” (dogs) and “Planet Pukers” (cats), while Earth’s fate hangs in the balance. Escaping from the Planet Pukers, who are after Kintaro, the two head to the hospital where the old man is hospitalized. Meanwhile, the old man, who is supposedly in critical condition, goes missing. The old man’s children request Gintoki’s services, but when he arrives at the hospital…
episodes.title: Cat Lovers and Dog Lovers Are Mutually Exclusive

episodes.plot: Otose arranges for Gintoki and the gang to spend their winter break at a hot spring inn located deep in the mountains. Anticipating a secluded hot spring bath, the group hikes their way up the mountain trail, only to arrive at a completely deserted and run-down inn. With no available bus to return to Edo, the gang has no choice but to stay at the inn. The inn’s Okami Oiwa welcomes the group, but Gintoki and Shinpachi notice a transparent being standing behind her back!
episodes.title: Fights Often Ensue During Trips

episodes.plot: The inn Gintoki and the gang are staying at turns out to be a ghost inn where all the stands (ghosts) gather, unable to enter heaven due to their attachment to the living world! Gintoki finds himself left all alone after Shinpachi, Kagura, and Otae are all possessed by stands. The Okami Oiwa explains she was looking for someone tough enough to help run the inn. Forced into working as an employee trainee, Gintoki must now join his co-worker Rei to greet the visiting stand customers…
episodes.title: Briefs Will Unavoidably Get Skidmarks

episodes.plot: Sick and tired of Oiwa’s tyranny, Gintoki decides to shut down the inn by teaming up with Rei. He plans to use Nobunaga, Hideyoshi, and Mitsuhide (their stands, that is) to bring down the inn’s reputation but is stopped by Okami Otose. Though overwhelmed at first by Okami’s most powerful stand Tagosaku, Gintoki nonetheless manages to exorcize the inn’s customers with the help of Shinpachi and the gang, who are now themselves living stands. With the fate of the inn and himself at stake, Gintoki finally enters a one-on-one battle with Oiwa.
episodes.title: Gin and His Excellency's Good-for-Nothings

episodes.plot: Gintoki strikes down Jiraia and frees Tsukuyo from his twisted web. Chiding Tsukuyo for trying to shoulder every burden herself, Gintoki goes on to say that rather than throw away your life to die beautifully, it’s far better to live and be yourself – even if your life is not a pretty one. And finally, Gintoki expresses his anger toward Jiraia for betraying his own student, despite calling himself a master.
episodes.title: Be Very Careful When Using Ghost Stories

episodes.plot: Once, the manga Gintaman gained immense popularity in Jump magazine, and was even made into an animated series thanks to Gintoki’s random advice. Ofuji has since taken over from Konishi as editor of Gintaman… But now the manga’s popularity is on a steady decline! Under these desperate circumstances, Gintoki is once again called forth to help fix the problem! Strong criticism and heated debate ensue between Ofuji, Konishi, and Amachi Sensei, along with their special guest. In the end, what sort of breakthrough solution have they come up with?!
episodes.title: Before Thinking About the Earth, Think About the More Endangered Gintaman's Future!

episodes.plot: As always, Hasegawa, aka MADAO idles away his life. While talking on the phone with his estranged wife Hatsu, Hasegawa ends up inviting her over to his house. But thanks to a string of misfortunes, his home is now a cardboard box in the park! Having told Hatsu that he lives in a pretty nice place, Hasegawa asks Gintoki to help him look for a descent housing…
episodes.title: It's your house, you build it

episodes.plot: Characters unhappy with the popularity poll results begin attacking high-ranking characters. Surrounded by the low-ranking characters, Shinpachi attempts to escape across the rooftops but loses his footing and falls. Just when Shinpachi thinks he’s done for, he is saved by an unknown hand and manages to flee from Catherine and the other low-ranking characters. When everybody is an enemy, which character would be willing to lend a helping hand?
episodes.title: 99% Of Men Are Not Confident In Confessing Their Love

episodes.plot: Characters unhappy with the popularity poll results begin attacking high-ranking characters. Surrounded by the low-ranking characters, Shinpachi attempts to escape across the rooftops but loses his footing and falls. Just when Shinpachi thinks he’s done for, he is saved by an unknown hand and manages to flee from Catherine and the other low-ranking characters. When everybody is an enemy, which character would be willing to lend a helping hand?
episodes.title: Let's Talk About the Old Days Once in a While

episodes.plot: The Odd Jobs are requested to remove a hornets’ nest on the temple grounds. Fully armored in protective suits, what awaits the trio is a ginormous hive, like none they’ve ever seen before. Arguing that this wasn’t what they signed up for, Gintoki prepares to leave, but Kagura goes off and destroys the hive. The trio quickly plays dead to avoid getting attacked by the raging hornets, but are instead greeted by something quite unexpected...
episodes.title: Don't Put Your Wallet In Your Back Pocket

episodes.plot: Okita is going through a selection of sweets at the cake shop. As Okita leaves the store, a girl suddenly comes up and stabs him!! Calling Okita her father’s killer, the girl’s action seems to be fueled by a past case called the “Rokkaku Incident.” What is the connection between this incident and Okita, as well as the girl’s father? And more importantly, what’s the fate of Okita who’s been stabbed right at the start of this episode?!
episodes.title: Beware of Those Who Use an Umbrella on a Sunny Day!

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Shinpachi start re-investigating the Rokkaku incident. Upon learning what really happened from Kamiyama, one of Okita’s subordinates, they leave to save Okita. Meanwhile, Okita is captured by Sotatsu Tendo after falling into his trap involving Kirie. Tendo babbles on about how he returned to seek revenge against Okita, who destroyed the Sokai Faction, and goes on to reveal the truth about Kirie’s father.
episodes.title: Butting Into a Fight is Dangerous

episodes.plot: As Gintoki and the gang head toward Hosen’s lair, they encounter Abuki, one of Kamui’s subordinates, and are overwhelmed by the incredible fighting power of the Yato Clan. On Shinpachi and Kagura’s urging, Gintoki heads out to face Hosen alone. The remaining two fight desperately against Abuki, only to be cornered by the overwhelming difference in power. In the midst of the fierce battle Kagura renews her feelings toward her older brother Kamui and her reason for fighting. But with Shinpachi’s life in danger, Kagura goes through a dramatic transformation…
episodes.title: Life is about making consecutive decisions

episodes.plot: Amidst the fierce battle, Kagura awakens to her Yato instincts and defeats Abuto. Thanks to Shinpachi’s desperate plea, Kagura is able to return to her senses and together they head after Hosen. Meanwhile Kamui has brought Seita before Hinowa, who is confined to her quarters. “Mom, let’s go home together!” Seita shouts out to his beloved mother. However, unexpected words leave Hinowa’s mouth…
episodes.title: Those Who Stand On Four Legs Are Beasts. Those Who Stand on Two Legs, Guts, and Glory, Are Men

episodes.plot: While on a job observing stray cats at a shrine feeding themselves,the Yorozuya waiting for the boss cat to show up with the name Hoichi. But as he finally shows up, and Kagura and Shinpachi jump out of the bushes to capture him, he escapes easily. So they ask Gintoki to help out, when they notice that he mysteriously disappeared.
episodes.title: Don't Trust Bedtime Stories

episodes.plot: The only way to defeat Hosen is to bring back the Sun to the Yoshiwara Shangri-La, the city trapped within eternal night. Seita runs for the control room to break open the iron-plated seal covering the city. Meanwhile, Gintoki and the Hyakka led by Tsukuyo are desperately holding off Hosen’s attack. But despite their best efforts, they cannot stop the King of The Night’s onslaught…King
episodes.title: The Color for Each Person's Bond Comes in Various Colors

episodes.plot: While protecting Gintoki from the stray cats, Hoichi and the cats get caught. Soon Gintoki, Katsura and Kondo goes to save him.
episodes.title: The taste of drinking under broad daylight is something special

episodes.plot: It is shortly after the fierce battle at Yoshiwara Shngri-la. Shinpachi and Kagura, having faced powerful foes in Hosen and Kamui unlike any they have encountered, are training hard after realizing their lack of strength. Both announce to Gintoki their determination to become stronger. But Gintoki declines to become involved, saying it’s a pain. Learning of the situation, Otae and Hasegawa share their training secrets, but…
episodes.title: All Adults are Instructors for All Children

episodes.plot: The episode begins with a short sequence about Kamui transferring into Yato High School and is told from Abuto's point of view. While the Shinsengumi are out on a mission, Hijikata notices snot coming out of Kondo's nose so he wonders how he could tell him without the others noticing Kondos problem. In the end the snot even takes control over Kondo's body and it comes out that Kondo's true identity is being an Amanto in snot form. As Hijikata destroys it, he realizes it has been all a dream.
episodes.title: Zip Up Your Fly Nice and Slowly

episodes.plot: As the bombing of the Shinsengumi headquarters nears, Hijikata and Okita are still unable to find any means for escape. Only one key exists to unlock the shackles chaining each other. But if the key is used, it will set off a bomb to kill the other. The rule of the devil begins to stir distrust between the two. Though he commends them for not betraying one another, Jigzaw pressures them to make the final decision by displaying a certain item.
episodes.title: When breaking a Chuubert in half, the end with the knob should be better. It's also tasty to drink from there

episodes.plot: The Odd Jobs trio is going about their usual meaningless chatter when a man with an eye-patch suddenly shows up and begins “ordering” them around. The man’s “power” is so strong, the Odd Jobs find themselves unable to defy his orders…
episodes.title: If You Can't Beat Them, Join Them

episodes.plot: Gintoki visits a barber shop to get his hair cut. After Kagura mentions that the seventh volume of the manga Abu is missing, the barber runs off to buy the volume and leaves the Yorozuya to look after the shop. After a while Katsura and Kondo enter the shop to get an image change. Then the Shogun enters suddenly the shop and wants a hair cut, too. The Yorozuya fall into despair because they don't even know how to cut hair properly.
episodes.title: A Conversation With a Barber During a Haircut is The Most Pointless Thing in The World

episodes.plot: The Shogun wants Gintoki, Kagura and Shinpachi to redo his mage. After Kagura is trying to ask the Shogun how he wants his hair done, she vomits and a Naruto gets stuck on the Shogun's head. Then the three Yorozuya try removing it with a razor and accidentally cut off the Shogun's mage. To cover up their mistake they try to find a replace for it.
episodes.title: The Heavens Created Chonmage Above Man Instead of Another Man

episodes.plot: Kagura can't fall asleep , so she goes to Gintoki's room and troubles him about her problem. After few methods, she finally fells asleep while listening to a story from a radio show. Unfortunately Gintoki listened to this Horror story as well, and now he can't fall aleep.
episodes.title: Sleep Helps a Child Grow

episodes.plot: It's Christmas in Edo and Kagura writes her father a letter. She is sad that Santa Claus never visited her. Moved, her father Umi Bozu dresses himself up as Santa and hides watching Kagura, Otae, Shinpachi and Hasegawa celebrate Christmas. When he finally jumps out of the bushes to surprise her there is another Santa, a dressed up Gintoki. Both of them think that their counterpart is real. They start punching each other when another three Santas show up (Sachan, Kondo and Kyubei). Kagura decides on a contest to see who's the real Santa.
episodes.title: That person looks different from usual during a birthday party

episodes.plot: The contest has finally begun but instead of a real contest to decide who's the real Santa, Kagura, Otae and the five Santas together with Shinpachi and Hasegawa are shown in various scenes playing a role like a school girl and not fighting each other like in a real contest. In each scene they imagine, the Santa has to show his kind of version what he would do as Santa and this is judged by Kagura, Otae and Hasegawa. Although in the end none of the Santas has any desire to continue with this contest so they all quit. The episode ends with Kagura, all along figured out the identity of everyone, wishing everybody a Merry Christmas.
episodes.title: The other side of the other side of the other side would be the other side

episodes.plot: Yatai “Guchiri-Ya” (Whining Store) has three rules: One, a customer can come in alone and whine as much as they want. Two, if there’s a familiar face, pretend like you don’t know them. And three, do not share the stories you hear. Tonight’s customers are a drowsy-looking samurai with a sweet tooth, a Mayo samurai, and finally Mr. Gorilla (pseudonym). Though permitted to whine, the three customers cannot help feeling awkward about it. So the master speaks on their behalf and spills their usual complaints, causing panic amongst the group. Just then, a familiar-looking woman enters the Yatai and begins attacking the other customers with sharp words (and weapons)!
episodes.title: It Takes a Bit of Courage to Enter a Street Vendor's Stand

episodes.plot: Today’s Tsu Terakado concert is another lively success. But fan club president Shinpachi is angered because only four of the Tsu Terakado fan club members have come to the concert. He is further enraged to learn that many of the club members have left without permission and have joined the new Tsusentai fan club instead. To Shinpachi’s surprise, the Tsusentai leader is Hijikata, who thanks to the demonic sword’s curse has now become a charismatic otaku! Can Shinpachi protect his only(?) distinctive trait from Tosshi’s onslaught?!
episodes.title: Any Place Can Become a Battlefield When Men Gather

episodes.plot: The fierce battle begins over the title of the Official Tsu Terakado fan club. Tosshi, Hijikata’s loser otaku personality created from a demonic sword, was once thought to have been defeated by Hijikata’s strong will, but in reality the personality still survives within him. By reigning as the king of otaku, Hijikata plans to put Tosshi’s soul to rest. Tosshi’s road to the king of otaku versus Shinpachi’s love for Otsu-chan. Who shall be victorious?!
episodes.title: If a Friend Gets Injured, Take Him to the Hospital, Stat!

episodes.plot: The preliminary round for the Official Tsu Terakado fan club title is a marathon race. With Takachin in critical condition and Kagura taking the wrong route, team Shinpachi’s chances of winning look slim. But thanks to Gintoki’s quick thinking, Takachin makes an instant (and improved?) recovery and emerges from the hospital to rejoin the race! As the race gradually turns into a battle of deception, Shinpachi runs furiously for the goal. Will he be able to beat the tactical general Tosshi?!
episodes.title: If one orange in the box is rotten, the rest of them will become rotten before you realize it!

episodes.plot: Tosshi finishes the preliminary race in first place by rounding up all the contestants to block Shinpachi’s team from making the goal. Despite Toshi’s scheming, team Otsu-chan fan club makes a surprising comeback to finish in second place! Hijikata points out that the team cheated by changing their member lineup, but with his own member suspected of using a taxi, the objection is dropped. Kondo and Kagura also finish the race after taking the wrong route and being dropped off by the police. Meanwhile, what happened to Shinpachi who’s still in the race? That being said and done, the main event finally takes place!
episodes.title: From a foreigner's perspective, you're the foreigner. From an alien's perspective, you're the alien

episodes.plot: For the second round in the Official Tsu Terakado fan club championships, it is a battle of charms. Both teams must come up with a virtualized situation where the winner is decided by Otsu-chan saying “yes.” First up is the Tsusengumi’s story, taking place in a bar with a beautiful night view. But the romantic mood is ruined thanks to Okita the narrator and assistants Kondo and “Mohawk” Yamazaki going out of control. Hijikata begins to panic, but with Kondo and the others’ carefully crafted stage direction he succeeds in asking Otsu-chan out. Shinpachi’s team find themselves in a tight situation, but...?
episodes.title: Laputa's still good after seeing it so many times

episodes.plot: The time to settle the battle for the official fan club title is finally here. The match between Shinpachi and Hijikata is a card battle using Otsu chip playing cards. Never knowing such a thing existed, Shinpachi rushes to the vendor for some cards. Hijikata on the other hand is fully prepared and delivers the ultra powerful card “Melancholy 5-minutes before start”! Hijikata’s range of powerful attacks forces Shinpachi to stay on the defensive. Can he possibly find a way to make a counterattack?
episodes.title: Love Is Unconditional

episodes.plot: After an intense battle, Shinpachi and Hijikata both fall to the ground with zero life points. Despite being exhausted and battered, the two men rise up to resume their battle. They fight as if their lives—no, their very souls—were on the line and Otsu begs them to stop. But nobody can stop them now. For their battle is no longer just for the title of official fan club...
episodes.title: The Black Ships Even Make A Scene When They Sink

episodes.plot:
PART A - Rumors of Yorozuya imposters gaining popularity within the city reach Gintoki’s ears. Upon investigating, the Odd Jobs Trio discover that someone is using their Yorozuya name for fishy business and making a fortune out of it. Gintoki and the gang seek out to uncover the imposters’ identities, only to discover...?! 

PART B - A man dressed in blue full-body spandex appears before Shinpachi. The “Blue Man” begins talking to a dumbfounded Shinpachi. He claims to have come from the future, but...
episodes.title: That Matsutake Soup Stuff Tastes Better than the Real Deal - If a Person Is Dead, They Can't Come Back to Life

episodes.plot: The city is hit by a bad flu one winter day. Even Otae is sick with the flu. Shinpachi gets some long-awaited time alone with his sister and is tending to her when he gets a visit from Gintoki and Kagura. Turns out the two have also caught the flu and want Shinpachi to look after them. Irritated by Gintoki and Kagura’s abrupt visit, not to mention their selfish demands, Shinpachi is surprised when even more sick guests arrive.
episodes.title: If It Works Once, It'll Work Over And Over Again

episodes.plot: Pirako has double crossed Gin! Her real plan is to help Jirocho, her father, take over the town. Can Gin stop a war?
episodes.title: Two Is Better Than One. Two People Are Better Than One

episodes.plot: Tama works hard everyday starting early in the morning. Even when Otose tells her to take a break, Tama won’t and says she is happy just being with everyone. But Otose notices that Tama’s appearance has changed into that of an angular polygon from an old video game! While Otose and Gintoki discuss that it must have been brought on by overwork, Tama returns from shopping and has now regressed from polygons to pixels!! Why is she going through these changes? And will she be able to return to normal?!
episodes.title: Smooth Polygons Smooth Men's Hearts Too

episodes.plot: Tama, Tatsumi, Tetsuko, Kozen, Madao, Kyoshiro. Everybody is out in full force to fight for the Kabuki District. Male escorts vs. trannies, Cabaret girls vs. Yakuza, robots blowing things up. It’s an all-out war!
episodes.title: A Human Body Is Like a Little Universe

episodes.plot: Jirocho and Gin battle Kada's elite Harusame forces while the rest of the denizens of Kabuki-cho take on her main forces in the streets. Kada is utterly stunned when her elite forces are beat by just these two humans, and flees the scene. Gin then helps Jirocho resolve his issues regarding Tatsugoro; Otose and Jirocho reconcile at the hospital. Outside the hospital, Kada desperately launches one last feeble attempt at conquering Kabuki-cho, but is stopped in her tracks by Pirako and the Yorozuya - Kada settles for swearing that the Harusame will be back, and flees yet again. At the very end, Jirocho denounces all other names he has ever been called except for Father of Pirako, and goes with his daughter back to the country.
episodes.title: The Chosen Idiots

episodes.plot: At last, Gintoki and his friends confront the Great Archfiend. While the Leukocyte King can’t lay a finger on the Great Archfiend who has taken Tama’s form, Gintoki attacks without giving a damn. Angered by his reckless impudence, the Leukocyte King turns on Gintoki. The Great Archfiend then takes the form of the Leukocyte King’s father. But this time Shinpachi and Kagura attack him, and they succeed in kicking him off the throne. The Odd Jobs trio takes this chance to finish the Great Archfiend off, but...
episodes.title: And into the Legend...

episodes.plot:
Part A On top of the Odd Jobs building, two awfully familiar men seem to be scheming. They manage to hide themselves from several visitors, but they are spotted by the man who’ll cause the biggest mess of all: Katsura! 

Part B Gintoki’s alarm goes off, and he decides to takes a shower to sober up. While in the shower, something happens to Gintoki! Seems Kagura and Shinpachi are also caught up in the mess, and they wonder how this could have happened to them... The three heroes face a crisis like none other!
episodes.title: If You Keep Copying, They Will Retaliate - A Loss Opens Your Eyes to the Love You Have

episodes.plot: A man called Executioner Kohei is brought under strict guard to the Shinsengumi. He is the executive officer of the Radical Joi Faction, the Akatsuki Party, and is also a lethal murderer who has killed 35 bakufu officials. According to Kondo, Kohei not only endures torture, but laughs with joy during it. The Shinsengumi’s mission is to get Kohei to tell them details about the large-scale terrorist attack the Akatsuki Party is supposedly planning. First off is Yamazaki, who goes to the investigation room to take a stab at it! Will he be able to get Kohei to talk?!
episodes.title: Using the Carrot and the Stick Method Depends on the Situation

episodes.plot:
Part A “It's What's On The Inside That Counts" While taking Sadaharu out for a walk, Gintoki runs into Katsura who is with some “thing” that hardly resembles Elizabeth. Shinpachi and Kagura also notice the change in Elizabeth, or more like being totally replaced, and decide to bring Katsura back to his senses. 

Part B “It's What's On The Inside That Counts, But Only To A Certain Extent” It is morning and Gintoki wakes up in his closet for some reason. Dumbfounded, he makes his way to his bedroom after going to the bathroom, only to find himself already sleeping in his bed. Realizing that something funny is happening to him yet again, he tries to resolve it through trial and error.
episodes.title: It's What's On The Inside That Counts - It's What's On The Inside That Counts, But Only To A Certain Extent

episodes.plot: Kagura helps a iwamatsu, the last part have the yoruzuya and shinsengumi in the bathhouse just as neighbor Hedero arrives with family members visiting Edo.
episodes.title: Are There Still People Who Go to the Ocean and Yell 'Bakayaro!' - When a Person Is Trapped, Their Inner Door Opens

episodes.plot: Gintoki’s mouth is swollen like crazy, forcing him to go to the dentist for treatment. Unable to cope with the stress and pressure of waiting, a crazed Gintoki screams for someone to just kill him and be done with it. After getting scolded by the staff, Gintoki waits for his turn when another man with a swollen mouth comes in, making things even more complicated!
episodes.title: No Matter How Old You Get, You Still Hate the Dentist

episodes.plot: A look back at Gintama's best moments.
episodes.title: Countdown Begins

episodes.plot: Gintoki and the gang return to Yoshiwara at Hinowa’s request for the first time in a while. Although Hosen’s death has brought freedom to Yoshiwara, it’s also drawn the renewed interest of those who previously avoided Yoshiwara in fear of Hosen’s power. Yoshiwara is now troubled with an increased crime rate, especially illegal drug dealing. Odd Jobs are asked to capture the man responsible. The man in question is said to go by various names, titles, and even faces. The only clue available is the tattooed spider on his neck.
episodes.title: It's Bad Luck to See a Spider at Night

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Tsukuyo infiltrate the Benigumoto, the Red Spiders, to get a lead on the man with the tattooed spider on his neck, but are discovered and quickly surrounded. The two manage to fend for themselves, when the man with the tattooed spider makes a sudden appearance and attacks Gintoki! The man then speaks as if he knows Tsukuyo. Who is this man?!
episodes.title: Once You're Entangled in a Spiderweb, It's Hard to Get It Off

episodes.plot: Tsukuyo falls into the hands of Jiraia, her former master, and is held captive. Meanwhile Gintoki manages to survive the attack thanks to Zenzo, and he learns about Jiraia’s past. During the Amanto attack twenty years ago, Jiraia is said to have killed his own people within the Oniwabanshu, all for the sake of his devotion to the previous shogun. In the end Jiraia himself was the one to be terminated, but he managed to escape. Now his devotion is directed toward his own creation, Tsukuyo. Jiraia’s motive is to eliminate the bond that she has come to rely upon. And he intends to achieve that goal by setting fire to Yoshiwara and burning down everything!
episodes.title: It's the Irresponsible One Who's Scary When Pissed

episodes.plot: Gintoki strikes down Jiraia and frees Tsukuyo from his twisted web. Chiding Tsukuyo for trying to shoulder every burden herself, Gintoki goes on to say that rather than throw away your life to die beautifully, it’s far better to live and be yourself – even if your life is not a pretty one. And finally, Gintoki expresses his anger toward Jiraia for betraying his own student, despite calling himself a master.
episodes.title: The More Precious the Burden, The Heavier and More Difficult it is to Shoulder

episodes.plot: Gintoki continues creating havoc in the prison.
episodes.title: Watch Out For A Set of Women and A Drink

episodes.plot: Character popularity results are announced to celebrate Gintama’s 182nd episode! Shinpachi is alone at the café, feeling depressed after learning that he’s still in 8th place in popularity, unchanged from the previous ranking. Yamazaki, who is in 9th place, drops by to say that boring characters such as they should aim to become the No. 1 steppingstone for others. For Shinpachi and Yamazaki, 8th and 9th place should hold the same meaning as 1st. But in reality Yamazaki can’t give up the hope of ranking higher, and runs off in tears. Shinpachi can do nothing but watch, when suddenly Yamazaki’s scream is heard in the distance!
episodes.title: Screw Popularity Votes

episodes.plot: Shinpachi introduces his new girlfriend to Otae...but she turns out to be Momo-san, a character from the popular Love Choris game. There are more and more boys in Edo who can no longer distinguish game from reality like Shinpachi. Otae asks Gintoki to bring Shinpachi back to the real world. The only way is by entering the world of Love Choris and talking some sense into him. Gintoki ends up choosing a very unique heroine to be his girlfriend...
episodes.title: Popularity Polls Can Burn in Hell

episodes.plot: Gintoki challenges Shinpachi in the ultimate Love Chorus tournament in order to break his illusion of his virtual girlfriend.
episodes.title: Popularity Polls Can...

episodes.plot: The Odd Jobs are requested to remove a hornets’ nest on the temple grounds. Fully armored in protective suits, what awaits the trio is a ginormous hive, like none they’ve ever seen before. Arguing that this wasn’t what they signed up for, Gintoki prepares to leave, but Kagura goes off and destroys the hive. The trio quickly plays dead to avoid getting attacked by the raging hornets, but are instead greeted by something quite unexpected...
episodes.title: Hometowns and Boobs Are Best Thought of from Afar - The Whole Peeing on a Bee Sting Is a Myth. You'll Get Germs, So Don't Do It!!

episodes.plot: The Shinsengumi and the Yorozuya attend the funeral of a close udon shop owner. Instead of moving on, however, the soul of the old man is overseeing the ceremony.
episodes.title: Beware of Foreshadows

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Shinpachi start re-investigating the Rokkaku incident. Upon learning what really happened from Kamiyama, one of Okita’s subordinates, they leave to save Okita. Meanwhile, Okita is captured by Sotatsu Tendo after falling into his trap involving Kirie. Tendo babbles on about how he returned to seek revenge against Okita, who destroyed the Sokai Faction, and goes on to reveal the truth about Kirie’s father.
episodes.title: It's Goodbye Once a Flag Is Set

episodes.plot: Students at a temple school share their independent research projects completed during the past summer vacation. After one of the students finishes reading a well-written journal, the last one to present is a kid named Daigoro. Sleeping in on the first day of summer vacation, Daigoro arrived late at the radio exercises and met Madao, and decided to keep an observation journal about him.
episodes.title: An Observation Journal Should Be Seen Through To The Very End

episodes.plot:
Part 1 -  While researching the Anti-Foreigner War, a reporter interviews Nagai, a former reporter from the war called Nagai in order to know about the White Demon's (Gintoki's alter-ego) activities in such time. He chronicles the events from war, explaining how the samurais decided to fight against the aliens. As Nagai is about to talk about the White Demon, he replaces him with the fictional robot Gundam to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the franchise with the same name.

Part 2 - Kagura starts going to Kabuki-cho's physical fitness lessons where she meets a kid named Hongou Hiashi, whom she befriends. Suffering from a dangerous disease that weakens his body, Hiashi is absent from various lessons even though he promised Kagura to go to every lesson. During a rainy day, Kagura is the only person to come to the lesson, but Gintoki and her friends decide to join her. Next day, Hiashi returns to another lesson and sees Kagura once again.
episodes.title: We Know It's Best to Finish Yearly Tasks Before the End of the Year, But then You Put It Off Till Next Year for a Fresh Start. That's How the End of the Year Goes - Radio Exercises are Socials for Boys and Girls

episodes.plot: Elizabeth and Dark Vader battle to the death and just when things are not looking so good for Elizabeth, Katsura shows up to save his friend.
episodes.title: When Looking For Something, Try Using its Perspective

episodes.plot: Having turned into cats, Gintoki,Katsura and Kondo (who turned into a gorilla) are brought by Hoichi to Otose to get food. While eating, Otose tells them that if caught, they can never return to this town.
episodes.title: Freedom Means to Live True to Yourself, not Without Law!

episodes.plot: While protecting Gintoki from the stray cats, Hoichi and the cats get caught. Soon Gintoki, Katsura and Kondo goes to save him.
episodes.title: Kabukicho Stray Cat Blues

episodes.plot: Everybody's stranded in the middle of the mountains. To make things worse, the Shogun goes missing.
episodes.title: Cooking is About Guts

episodes.plot: The episode begins with a short sequence about Kamui transferring into Yato High School and is told from Abuto's point of view. While the Shinsengumi are out on a mission, Hijikata notices snot coming out of Kondo's nose so he wonders how he could tell him without the others noticing Kondos problem. In the end the snot even takes control over Kondo's body and it comes out that Kondo's true identity is being an Amanto in snot form. As Hijikata destroys it, he realizes it has been all a dream.
episodes.title: Whenever I Hear Leviathan, I Think of Sazae-san. Stupid Me!!

episodes.plot: Lately the weather forecasts Ketsuno Ana is predicting are always wrong. When Gintoki meets her on the streets he takes her to the Yorozuya's place to help her.But after a monster attacks the house,it is revealed that Ketsuno Anna is an onmyouji and some other onmyouji is targeting her. After that Gintoki and the others are on the way to the Ketsuno residence,where they fight some odd creatures.
episodes.title: Not Losing to the Rain

episodes.plot: The number one host in the Kabuki district, Kyoshiro, summons the Odd Jobs members to his club, Takamagahara, and tells them that he intends to quit because of a lady named Madame Yagami who controls the night world. It seems that she declared she would be making a second visit to Takamagahara, which is essentially a death sentence. The hosts at Kyoshiro's have quit out of fear, so Gintoki and co must find hosts to handle the Madame...
episodes.title: Not Losing to the Wind

episodes.plot: The Madame's arrival is imminent. Kyoshiro, Gintoki, and friends attempt to scout some help, but they end up with a bunch of oddballs. And it turns out that Otae has invited guests from all over town who go wild and leave the bar and Kyoshiro broken! There's no time to worry about taking care of customers. But at the worst possible time, Madame Yagami arrives!
episodes.title: Not Losing to the Storm

episodes.plot: Jellybeans Vanguard Honda is on his fifth year as a Jump editor. However, he's been assigned to the manga Gintaman, which has driven multiple editors insane. In order to save himself, Honda must find a new talented artist so he can be reassigned. One day, he is visited by an aspiring manga artist by the name of N3016. Is this artist as juvenile as his name suggests?
episodes.title: Never Losing that Smile

episodes.plot: The Sasaki family is as elite as it gets, and one of its members, Tetsunosuke, has joined the Shinsengumi. He would have joined the Mimawarigumi, a police force with pedigree, but he is considered a troublemaker, which is why he was sent to the Shinsengumi. Kondo assigns Tetsu to Hijikata as an assistant, so Hijikata is forced to endure the new recruit...
episodes.title: That's How I Wish to Be, Beautiful and Strong

episodes.plot: It's Christmas in Edo and Kagura writes her father a letter. She is sad that Santa Claus never visited her. Moved, her father Umi Bozu dresses himself up as Santa and hides watching Kagura, Otae, Shinpachi and Hasegawa celebrate Christmas. When he finally jumps out of the bushes to surprise her there is another Santa, a dressed up Gintoki. Both of them think that their counterpart is real. They start punching each other when another three Santas show up (Sachan, Kondo and Kyubei). Kagura decides on a contest to see who's the real Santa.
episodes.title: Santa Claus Red Is Blood Red

episodes.plot: Tetsunosuke has been ordered to deliver a letter for Hijikata. However, he's captured by the radical Joi Check It Out gang in the process. Tetsunosuke had concealed his identity to join the gang, but now they know that he has connections to the police. He's taken hostage as leverage over the Shinsengumi and Mimawarigumi. However, the Mimawarigumi shows no concern for the hostage and plots to place the blame squarely on the Shinsengumi. Hijikata and the other members are enraged after learning Isaburo's plans. The Shinsengumi and Mimawarigumi are now in an all-out fight.
episodes.title: Everybody's a Santa!

episodes.plot: Shinpachi Shimura returns to the Yorozuya and discovers his friends drastically changed during the break. Feeling left behind, he returns home and discovers his sister, Tae Shimura, engaged to Isao Kondo. Tae and Kando enlists Shinpachi into the Shinsengumi and reveals that Tae is pregnant. Shinpachi runs to the ocean and laments the sudden change of those around him. There, he learns about Kyubei Yagyu's sex change to modify her life. They are interrupted by and Kotaro Katsura who also changed his genre due to his Kyubei's characters similarities.
episodes.title: Everyone Looks a Little Grown Up After Spring Break

episodes.plot: As Katsura and Kyubei fight for the title of the best transgendered, Shinpachi leaves to find that the Shinsengumi members also suffered a sudden change in their selves; Sogo Okita is the leader from the group and orders him and Toshiro Hijikata, Sagaru Yamazaki to attack the Yorozuya. As the three leave, Hijikata knocks out Yamazaki, as he was faking his change. He and Shinpachi learn that an invasion of parasite aliens is responsible for change to their friends and proceed to destroy them. However, they find problems in the outcome, and both Hijikata and and Shinpachi are knocked out in the process, with Gintoki being actually only person without a parasite.
episodes.title: Everyone Looks Pretty Grown Up After Summer Break

episodes.plot: As Gintoki complains of writing News Years cards, Yorozuya learn of what his friends have done over the holidays. He also receives cards saying his friends have gotten married, while they have lied and just Photoshopped the photos. The episode ends with Kondo, Sachan and Hasegawa telling their story of how they wrote a News Years card. The second part starts with the same opening, but Gin complains of the lack of chocolate. Kagura has a chocolate for Gintoki and Shinpachi, but is too embarrassed to give to them. She enlists the help of Tsukuyo, and Sachan to help, but they are each too embarrassed to help her and make her give their chocolates to Gintoki. She indifferently give Gintoki and Shipachi the chocolate saying they were on the door step, as the happily run for the chocolate, they find all the chocolates were said to be from Kagura.
episodes.title: Use a Calligraphy Pen for New Year Cards - The Heart Comes Before Chocolate

episodes.plot: Yamazaki has a mental breakdown cause of Anpans and Kondo finally gets a date (Or does he!)
episodes.title: Meals Should Be Balanced - We Are All Warriors in the Battle Against Fate

episodes.plot: Catherine appears to have a boyfriend and has drastically improved her appearance. Her boyfriend is a regular at Snack Otose, an entrepreneur by the name of Suejiro. Catherine decides to leave the Kabuki district to start a new bar with him.
episodes.title: It's Too Confusing When Talking About the Poster Girl for a Poster Store, So Call Her a Sandwich Board

episodes.plot: The Odd Jobs' TV breaks out with Sachan inside. Gintoki tells Sadaharu to throw her away with the TV, but Sachan's precious glasses are broken in the process. Gintoki reluctantly buys Sa-chan a new pair of glasses, but they are bottle bottom glasses that are clearly the wrong prescription. Sa-chan is overjoyed that Gintoki has given her a present, but the new glasses are responsible for a chain of failures on her assassination job. Her superiors now question her commitment.
episodes.title: Glasses Are Part of the Soul

episodes.plot: Gintoki and crew continue to defend Sarutobi against the Lethal Punishers. But against such assassins as the Pillow Masa, T-shirt Tatsu, and the Chuubert Chu Brothers, will they win?
episodes.title: Glasses Prevent You From Seeing Certain Things

episodes.plot: Due to a lack of budget, the Yorozuya try to use old footage to make a filler episodes. While Hasegawa first plays a theme song, the characters then watch a fake trailer a supposed second film based on the series. The episode ends with a chapter of "Teach us Ginpachi-sensei", a story in which Gintoki is the teacher from high school class composed of anime's characters.
episodes.title: Nothing Lasts Forever, Including Parents, Money, Youth, Your Room, Dress Shirts, Me, You and the Gintama Anime

episodes.plot: Pirako Chin is looking for the strongest man in the Kabuki District. Now Gintoki has an underling who wants to turn Kabuki District into a garden of bright red flowers.
episodes.title: A Lawless Town Tend To Attract a Bunch of Whoohooey Folk

episodes.plot: Pirako has double crossed Gin! Her real plan is to help Jirocho, her father, take over the town. Can Gin stop a war?
episodes.title: Ghosts Aren't The Only Ones Who Run Wild Around Graveyards

episodes.plot: Pirako is pleased to hear that Otose, the reason for Jirocho's attachment to the Kabuki district, has been eliminated. With Otose gone, the balance of power among the Four Devas has crumbled and a war is in the works in the Kabuki district. Meanwhile, the Odd Jobs crew is watching over Otose when Saigo appears and informs them that the bar will be destroyed by the Four Devas. He urges them to leave this town, now that they've lost their home...Finally, the day comes for them to leave Snack Otose.
episodes.title: Chains Of a Warrior

episodes.plot: Tama, Tatsumi, Tetsuko, Kozen, Madao, Kyoshiro. Everybody is out in full force to fight for the Kabuki District. Male escorts vs. trannies, Cabaret girls vs. Yakuza, robots blowing things up. It’s an all-out war!
episodes.title: Iron Town

episodes.plot: Jirocho and Gin battle Kada's elite Harusame forces while the rest of the denizens of Kabuki-cho take on her main forces in the streets. Kada is utterly stunned when her elite forces are beat by just these two humans, and flees the scene. Gin then helps Jirocho resolve his issues regarding Tatsugoro; Otose and Jirocho reconcile at the hospital. Outside the hospital, Kada desperately launches one last feeble attempt at conquering Kabuki-cho, but is stopped in her tracks by Pirako and the Yorozuya - Kada settles for swearing that the Harusame will be back, and flees yet again. At the very end, Jirocho denounces all other names he has ever been called except for Father of Pirako, and goes with his daughter back to the country.
episodes.title: 'Tis An Honor!

episodes.plot: Kagura's older brother, Kamui, visits Kada's cell where she is being kept after having been captured by the Kiheitai and loses at a game of odds or evens. He is approached by one of the 12 captains who tells him he has the 12 captains support if he chooses to overthrow Admiral Abo. Kamui orders his second to kill the members of the Kiheitai, isolating Takasugi so Kamui can duel him. As the Kiheitai's ship is about to be attacked the Admiral double crosses Kamui and imprisons him out of fear. Takasugi visits Kada's cell and loses at a game of odds or evens. After a brief conversation Takasugi rescues Kamui at his execution, overthrowing Admiral Abo. Kamui becomes Admiral and the episode ends with Takasugi visiting Kada's cell one last time to lose at a game of odds or evens.
episodes.title: Odds or Even

episodes.plot: Kagura invites a bunch of kids to the Yorozuya. They, along with other characters get shunned by them and invites them into a "factory tour".
episodes.title: I Can't Remember a Damn Thing About the Factory Tour

episodes.plot: Gintoki and Hasegawa have to help the shogun when he is at the pool
episodes.title: What Happen Twice Can Happen Thrice

episodes.plot: Otose sent a box of crab to the Yoruzuya. Before they can divide the crab's legs to themselves, suddenly, there came a blackout after the electricity came back one leg is missing and Gintoki ate it. Another blackout came and another leg was missing and Kagura ate it, saying she was attacked by a gorilla. Shinpachi then put up a candle. Then Gintoki and Kagura ate all of the legs. When Shinpachi claims the crab's whole body they found themselves fighting for a crab congee and ended up eating crab-flavored cheap food.
episodes.title: The Pincers of Crab Can Snip Through a Friendship

episodes.plot: Kagura helps a iwamatsu, the last part have the yoruzuya and shinsengumi in the bathhouse just as neighbor Hedero arrives with family members visiting Edo.
episodes.title: People Forget to Return Stuff All The Time Without Even Realizing It.

episodes.plot: Gin, Kondo, Hijkata, and Shin are stuck in the public bath with the demons. Every lie they tell digs their grave deeper. Can they really get away with kicking heads in, ripping off horns, and setting demons on fire with lotion?
episodes.title: The Bathhouse , Where You're Naked In Body And Soul

episodes.plot: The monkey, aka "Jugem Jugem... (abbreviated) Runny Diarrhea," has grown close to Kyubei. However, their time together did not last. The Shogun family ordered that the Yagyu return Runny Diarrhea. The monkey escapes from the Shogun family to see Kyubei again. Kyubei and the other Yagyu members are forced to continue a desperate and fruitless search for Runny Diarrhea.
episodes.title: Jugem

episodes.plot: The monkey, aka "Jugem Jugem... (abbreviated) Runny Diarrhea," has grown close to Kyubei. However, their time together did not last. The Shogun family ordered that the Yagyu return Runny Diarrhea. The monkey escapes from the Shogun family to see Kyubei again. Kyubei and the other Yagyu members are forced to continue a desperate and fruitless search for Runny Diarrhea.
episodes.title: The Name Reveals the Person

episodes.plot: Katsura infiltrates Matsudaira's household and ends up pondering family values.
episodes.title: The Man's Household Situation Is Hard , His Heart Is Soft

episodes.plot: The Yorozuya run into a mysterious Blu-ray DVD with a depressed female ghost in it. The ghost moves into their TV, making all the programs gloomy as well. Gintoki then attempts to find use for the ghost as a navigator.
episodes.title: Blue And Red Ecstasy

episodes.plot: Gintoki gets thrown in prison after being framed, and while he's made an enemy of the warden, he's managed to become the boss of the prisoners. With his underling Shachi in tow, Gintoki skips his menial labor duties to search the warden's room for anything incriminating. Understanding that the punishment will be fatal if they are caught, Gintoki disguises himself by putting on pajamas...
episodes.title: So In The Second Season Of Prison Break , They Already Broke Out Of Prison , But The Name Works When You Realize That Society Is A Prison

episodes.plot: Gintoki continues creating havoc in the prison.
episodes.title: Everybody Loves Pajamas

episodes.plot: Gintama meets Sket Dance! But not without trouble...
episodes.title: Speaking Of Crossovers , Don't Forget About Alien Vs Predator

episodes.plot: Shinpachi introduces his new girlfriend to Otae...but she turns out to be Momo-san, a character from the popular Love Choris game. There are more and more boys in Edo who can no longer distinguish game from reality like Shinpachi. Otae asks Gintoki to bring Shinpachi back to the real world. The only way is by entering the world of Love Choris and talking some sense into him. Gintoki ends up choosing a very unique heroine to be his girlfriend...
episodes.title: Love is Neither Plus No Minus

episodes.plot: Gintoki challenges Shinpachi in the ultimate Love Chorus tournament in order to break his illusion of his virtual girlfriend.
episodes.title: Making It Through Love

episodes.plot: Kagura wants a mobile phone of her own in order to be able to text with her friends. Her wish is granted, and she starts harassing Gintoki and Shinpachi through text messaging.
